Information Security Analyst.description: Plan and carry out security measures to protect an organization's computer networks and systems. Analyze security breaches and develop solutions to vulnerabilities.
Information Security Analyst.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
Information Security Analyst.job_outlook: 33% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Data Scientist.description: Use analytical tools and techniques to extract meaningful insights from data. Build predictive models and visualizations to help organizations make data-driven decisions.
Data Scientist.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, or a related field (advanced degrees often preferred)
Data Scientist.job_outlook: 36% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Web Developer.description: Create and maintain websites and web applications, ensuring functionality, performance, and usability. Collaborate with designers to implement site features.
Web Developer.typical_education: Educational requirements vary (high school diploma to bachelor's degree)

Frontend Developer.description: Build the visual components of a website or application that users interact with. Focus on user interface design, performance optimization, and responsive design.
Frontend Developer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field (or equivalent experience)

Network Architect.description: Design and implement data communication networks including LANs, WANs, and intranets. Plan network layout, choose hardware and protocols, and optimize performance and security.
Network Architect.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer or information science; extensive experience in network administration
Network Architect.job_outlook: 13% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

IT Manager.description: Plan, coordinate, and direct computer-related activities in an organization. Determine IT goals and implement computer systems to meet those goals.
IT Manager.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or IT (often with related work experience)
IT Manager.job_outlook: 17% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Research Scientist.description: Design innovative uses for new and existing computing technology. Conduct research and develop algorithms in areas like AI, machine learning, and data science.
Research Scientist.typical_education: Master's or doctoral degree in computer science or a related field
Research Scientist.job_outlook: 26% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Database Administrator.description: Create or organize systems to store and secure data. Ensure database performance, integrity, and security; implement backups and recovery procedures.
Database Administrator.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer and information technology or a related field
Database Administrator.job_outlook: 9% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Marketing Manager.description: Plan programs to generate interest in products or services. Coordinate advertising, promotions, and market research to boost sales.
Marketing Manager.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in marketing or business (experience in related role)

Market Research Analyst.description: Study consumer preferences, business conditions, and other factors to assess potential sales of a product or service. Gather and analyze data from surveys and reports.
Market Research Analyst.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in market research, statistics, or a related field

Management Analyst.description: Recommend ways to improve an organization's efficiency. Conduct organizational studies and design new systems and procedures.
Management Analyst.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in business, management, or related field (often with experience)
Management Analyst.job_outlook: 11% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Application Developer.description: Design, build, and maintain software applications for various platforms. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure applications meet user needs.
Application Developer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
Application Developer.job_outlook: 17% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

AI Engineer.description: Develop and implement AI tools, systems, and processes to perform tasks without human involvement. Train complex neural networks and machine learning models for real-world applications.
AI Engineer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related (advanced degree often preferred)
AI Engineer.job_outlook: Rapidly increasing demand (online job ads for AI Engineers grew ~300% from 2018–2022)

Computer Systems Analyst.description: Analyze an organization's computer systems and design solutions to improve efficiency and performance. Evaluate technology needs, implement system upgrades, and ensure that hardware and software meet user requirements and business goals.
Computer Systems Analyst.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, or related field
Computer Systems Analyst.job_outlook: 11% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

User Experience Designer.description: Design user interfaces and experiences for software and websites, focusing on usability, accessibility, and user satisfaction. Conduct user research, create wireframes and prototypes, and collaborate with developers to implement intuitive designs.
User Experience Designer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in human-computer interaction, design, computer science, or a related field

Game Designer.description: Conceptualize and design game mechanics, storylines, characters, and levels for video games. Work with artists, programmers, and producers to define game features and ensure engaging gameplay experiences.
Game Designer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in game design, computer science, or a related field
Game Designer.job_outlook: 4% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Level Designer.description: Design and create levels and environments for video games. Develop gameplay challenges, puzzles, and layouts that fit the overall game design, ensuring levels are engaging and aligned with artistic and narrative goals.
Level Designer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in game design, computer graphics, or a related field
Level Designer.job_outlook: 4% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Game Developer.description: Develop and maintain the software code for video games. Implement game functionality, optimize performance, and work with designers and artists to integrate graphics, physics, and networking features.
Game Developer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or game development
Game Developer.job_outlook: 17% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Software Developer.description: Design computer applications or programs and coordinate integration and debugging of components. Work with teams to develop software solutions based on user needs.
Software Developer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
Software Developer.job_outlook: 17% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Software Developer.description: Design computer applications or programs and coordinate integration and debugging of components. Work with teams to develop software solutions based on user needs.
Software Developer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
Software Developer.job_outlook: 17% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Web Designer.description: Create visually appealing and user-friendly websites. Focus on layout, color schemes, typography, and overall aesthetics while ensuring functionality and responsiveness.
required_skills: Graphic Design Tools (e.g., Adobe XD, Figma)
Web Designer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in web design, graphic design, or a related field (or equivalent experience)

Software Engineer.description: Design, develop, and maintain software applications and systems. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create scalable and efficient software solutions.
Software Engineer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
Software Engineer.job_outlook: 17% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

E-Commerce Specialist.description: Manage online sales strategies and platforms to drive e-commerce growth. Analyze market trends, optimize product listings, and enhance customer experience on e-commerce sites.
E-Commerce Specialist.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field
E-Commerce Specialist.job_outlook: 15% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

UI Engineer.description: Develop user interfaces for web applications, focusing on the look and feel of the application. Ensure that the UI is responsive, accessible, and provides a seamless user experience.
UI Engineer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field (or equivalent experience)

Health Informatics Specialist.description: Manage and analyze health information systems and electronic health records (EHR) to improve patient care and data security. Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and optimize clinical workflows and data reporting.
Health Informatics Specialist.typical_education: Associate's or Bachelor's degree in health informatics, healthcare management, or information technology
Health Informatics Specialist.job_outlook: 16% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Nurse Practitioner.description: Provide advanced nursing care including diagnosing conditions, prescribing medications, and managing patient treatment plans. Work independently or collaboratively with physicians in various healthcare settings.
Nurse Practitioner.typical_education: Master's degree in nursing (MSN) or Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP)
Nurse Practitioner.job_outlook: 38% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Physician Assistant.description: Practice medicine under physician supervision, conducting examinations, diagnosing illnesses, developing treatment plans, and prescribing medications. Provide comprehensive healthcare services.
Physician Assistant.typical_education: Master's degree from an accredited physician assistant program
Physician Assistant.job_outlook: 27% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Medical Coder.description: Assign standardized codes to medical diagnoses and procedures for billing and record-keeping purposes. Ensure accurate documentation and compliance with healthcare regulations.
Medical Coder.typical_education: Certificate or associate's degree in medical coding or health information management

Medical Records Technician.description: Organize and manage health information data, ensuring accuracy, accessibility, and security of patient records. Maintain electronic health record systems and support healthcare operations.
Medical Records Technician.typical_education: Associate's degree in health information technology or related field

Occupational Therapist.description: Help patients develop, recover, and improve skills needed for daily living and working. Design treatment programs to help people with disabilities, injuries, or illnesses achieve independence.
Occupational Therapist.job_outlook: 12% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Pharmacy Technician.description: Assist pharmacists with dispensing prescription medications, managing inventory, and providing customer service. Help ensure accurate medication preparation and patient safety.
Pharmacy Technician.typical_education: High school diploma plus on-the-job training or certificate program

Mental Health Counselor.description: Provide therapy and counseling services to individuals, families, and groups dealing with mental health issues, substance abuse, and life challenges. Develop treatment plans and provide ongoing support.
Mental Health Counselor.typical_education: Master's degree in counseling, psychology, or related field
Mental Health Counselor.job_outlook: 18% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Dietitian/Nutritionist.description: Plan and conduct food service or nutritional programs to assist in promotion of health and control of disease. Assess nutritional needs and develop meal plans for individuals and groups.
Dietitian/Nutritionist.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in dietetics, food science, or related field

Backend Developer.description: Design and maintain server-side applications, databases, and APIs that power web and mobile applications. Focus on server logic, database management, and system architecture.
Backend Developer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
Backend Developer.job_outlook: 17% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

DevOps Engineer.description: Combine software development and IT operations to streamline deployment processes, manage infrastructure, and ensure reliable system performance through automation and monitoring.
DevOps Engineer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field
DevOps Engineer.job_outlook: 17% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Database Engineer.description: Design, implement, and maintain complex database systems for high-performance applications. Optimize database performance, ensure data integrity, and manage large-scale data infrastructure.
Database Engineer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, or related field
Database Engineer.job_outlook: 9% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Cloud Architect.description: Design and oversee cloud computing strategies, including cloud adoption plans, cloud application design, and cloud management and monitoring. Lead cloud infrastructure initiatives.
Cloud Architect.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field, plus cloud certifications
Cloud Architect.job_outlook: 17% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Music Producer.description: Oversee and guide the recording process of musical artists and bands. Manage studio sessions, coordinate musicians, and shape the overall sound and direction of musical projects.
Music Producer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in music production, audio engineering, or related field (experience often more important)
Music Producer.job_outlook: 5% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Audio Engineer.description: Operate and maintain recording equipment in studios, live venues, and broadcast facilities. Mix, edit, and master audio recordings for music, film, television, and other media.
Audio Engineer.typical_education: Associate's or bachelor's degree in audio engineering or related field
Audio Engineer.job_outlook: 5% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Music Therapist.description: Use music interventions to accomplish individualized therapeutic goals for clients with disabilities or illnesses. Assess client needs and implement evidence-based music therapy treatments.
Music Therapist.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in music therapy from an approved program

Music Teacher.description: Teach music theory, performance, and appreciation to students of various ages and skill levels. Develop curriculum, conduct ensembles, and prepare students for performances and competitions.
Music Teacher.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in music education or music with teaching certification
Music Teacher.job_outlook: 4% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Music Composer.description: Create original music for various media including films, television, video games, commercials, and concert performances. Arrange and orchestrate musical compositions for different ensembles.
Music Composer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in music composition or related field

Music Director.description: Lead musical organizations such as orchestras, choirs, or bands. Plan concert programs, conduct rehearsals and performances, and manage artistic aspects of musical productions.
Music Director.typical_education: Master's degree in music, conducting, or related field

Sound Designer.description: Create audio elements for various media including films, television, video games, and theater productions. Design sound effects, ambient audio, and audio landscapes to enhance storytelling.
Sound Designer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in audio production, film, or related field
Sound Designer.job_outlook: 5% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Music Business Manager.description: Handle business affairs for musicians and music organizations. Manage contracts, bookings, marketing strategies, and financial aspects of music careers and organizations.
Music Business Manager.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in business, music business, or related field

Biomedical Engineer.description: Design and develop medical devices, equipment, and software that improve patient diagnosis and treatment. Apply engineering principles to healthcare problems, creating solutions like prosthetics, imaging systems, and health management software.
Biomedical Engineer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in biomedical engineering or a related engineering field (advanced degrees often preferred)

Clinical Research Coordinator.description: Coordinate and oversee clinical trials and research studies. Ensure compliance with protocols, manage patient recruitment, collect and analyze data, and maintain regulatory documentation.
Clinical Research Coordinator.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in life sciences, nursing, or related field

Genetic Counselor.description: Assess individual or family risk for genetic disorders and provide information and support to help people make informed decisions about genetic testing and healthcare management.
Genetic Counselor.typical_education: Master's degree in genetic counseling from an accredited program
Genetic Counselor.job_outlook: 16% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Medical Laboratory Technician.description: Perform laboratory tests on blood, tissue, and other body fluids to help diagnose diseases. Operate sophisticated laboratory equipment and analyze test results for healthcare providers.
Medical Laboratory Technician.typical_education: Associate's degree in medical laboratory technology or related field
Medical Laboratory Technician.job_outlook: 5% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Radiologic Technologist.description: Perform diagnostic imaging examinations such as X-rays, CT scans, MRI, and mammograms. Position patients, operate imaging equipment, and ensure image quality for medical diagnosis.

Pharmaceutical Scientist.description: Research and develop new medications and drug therapies. Conduct laboratory experiments, analyze drug interactions, and work on formulation development to create safe and effective pharmaceutical products.
Pharmaceutical Scientist.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in chemistry, biology, or pharmaceutical sciences (advanced degrees often preferred)

Medical Device Engineer.description: Design, develop, and test medical devices and equipment. Ensure products meet safety standards and regulatory requirements while solving complex healthcare challenges through innovative engineering solutions.
Medical Device Engineer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in biomedical engineering, mechanical engineering, or related field

Epidemiologist.description: Study patterns and causes of diseases in populations. Investigate disease outbreaks, analyze health data, and develop strategies for disease prevention and public health policy.
Epidemiologist.typical_education: Master's degree in epidemiology or public health
Epidemiologist.job_outlook: 26% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Biotechnology Research Scientist.description: Conduct research using living organisms or biological systems to develop new products and technologies. Work on projects ranging from drug discovery to agricultural improvements and environmental solutions.
Biotechnology Research Scientist.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in biology, biochemistry, or related field (advanced degrees often preferred)

Medical Science Liaison.description: Serve as scientific experts and communicate complex medical information between pharmaceutical companies and healthcare professionals. Provide clinical and scientific support for medical products.
Medical Science Liaison.typical_education: Advanced degree in medicine, pharmacy, or life sciences (PharmD, MD, PhD)

Surgical Technologist.description: Assist in surgical operations by preparing operating rooms, arranging equipment, and helping doctors and nurses during surgeries. Ensure sterile conditions and anticipate the needs of surgical teams.
Surgical Technologist.typical_education: Certificate or associate's degree in surgical technology

Medical Physicist.description: Apply physics principles to healthcare, particularly in radiation therapy, diagnostic imaging, and nuclear medicine. Ensure safe and effective use of radiation in medical procedures.
Medical Physicist.typical_education: Master's degree in medical physics or related field

Respiratory Therapist.description: Care for patients with breathing disorders by administering treatments, managing ventilators, and educating patients about respiratory health. Work with patients of all ages with conditions like asthma, COPD, and pneumonia.
Respiratory Therapist.job_outlook: 13% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Physical Therapist.description: Help patients recover from injuries and improve mobility through exercises, manual therapy, and specialized treatments. Develop treatment plans to restore function and prevent future injuries.
Physical Therapist.job_outlook: 15% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Medical Writer.description: Create scientific and medical documents including research papers, regulatory submissions, clinical study reports, and educational materials. Translate complex medical information for various audiences.
Medical Writer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in life sciences, medicine, or related field (advanced degrees often preferred)

Game Producer.description: Oversee the development of video games from concept to completion. Manage project timelines, budgets, and team coordination while ensuring games meet quality standards and market requirements.
Game Producer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in game development, business, or related field
Game Producer.job_outlook: 4% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Game Artist.description: Create visual elements for video games including characters, environments, textures, and animations. Work with art directors and designers to establish the visual style and aesthetic of games.
Game Artist.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in art, game design, or related field
Game Artist.job_outlook: 4% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Game Audio Designer.description: Create and implement sound effects, music, and audio elements for video games. Design immersive audio experiences that enhance gameplay and support the game's narrative and atmosphere.
Game Audio Designer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in audio production, music, or related field
Game Audio Designer.job_outlook: 4% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Game Quality Assurance Tester.description: Test video games to identify bugs, glitches, and gameplay issues before release. Document problems, verify fixes, and ensure games meet quality standards and provide good user experience.
Game Quality Assurance Tester.typical_education: High school diploma to bachelor's degree (game development or related field preferred)
Game Quality Assurance Tester.job_outlook: 4% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Technical Game Designer.description: Bridge the gap between game design and programming by implementing game systems, balancing mechanics, and creating tools for other developers. Focus on the technical aspects of game design.
Technical Game Designer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science, game design, or related field
Technical Game Designer.job_outlook: 4% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Esports Manager.description: Manage professional gaming teams and players in competitive esports. Handle team operations, sponsorship deals, tournament participation, and player development in the growing esports industry.
Esports Manager.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in business, sports management, or related field
Esports Manager.job_outlook: Rapidly growing field (esports industry expected to exceed $1.8 billion by 2025)

Game Community Manager.description: Engage with gaming communities to build relationships, gather feedback, and promote games. Manage social media, forums, and events to foster a positive community around games.
Game Community Manager.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in communications, marketing, or related field (experience in gaming preferred)
Game Community Manager.job_outlook: 4% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Content Writer.description: Create engaging and informative content for websites, blogs, social media, and other digital platforms. Research topics, write articles, and optimize content for search engines.
Content Writer.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in English, journalism, communications, or related field (experience in writing preferred)

Content Moderator.description: Review and moderate user-generated content on platforms to ensure compliance with community guidelines and policies. Identify and remove inappropriate content, respond to user reports, and maintain a safe online environment.
Content Moderator.typical_education: High school diploma or equivalent; some positions may require an associate's degree or relevant experience in digital media
Content Moderator.job_outlook: 5% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Executive Assistant.description: Provide high-level administrative support to executives and senior management. Responsibilities include managing schedules, coordinating meetings, preparing reports, and handling confidential information.
Executive Assistant.typical_education: Associate's degree or bachelor's degree in business administration or related field; experience in administrative roles preferred

Personal Assistant.description: Assist individuals with personal tasks such as scheduling appointments, managing household tasks, running errands, and providing general support to improve their daily lives.
Personal Assistant.typical_education: High school diploma or equivalent; experience in personal assistance or related fields preferred

Administrative Assistant.description: Provide administrative support to ensure efficient operation of the office. Responsibilities include managing files, scheduling appointments, handling correspondence, and assisting with various administrative tasks.
Administrative Assistant.typical_education: High school diploma or equivalent; some positions may require an associate's degree or specialized training in office administration
Administrative Assistant.job_outlook: 5% growth from 2023 to 2033 (about as fast as average)

Business Consultant.description: Provide expert advice to businesses to improve their performance, efficiency, and profitability. Analyze business problems, develop strategies, and implement solutions across various industries.
Business Consultant.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in business administration, management, or related field (advanced degrees often preferred)

Financial Analyst.description: Guide businesses and individuals in decisions about expending money to attain profit. Assess performance of stocks, bonds, and other investments.
Financial Analyst.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, or a related field
Financial Analyst.job_outlook: 9% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Financial Consultant.description: Advise individuals or businesses on financial planning, investment strategies, and risk management. Help clients achieve their financial goals through tailored financial solutions.
Financial Consultant.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or related field (certifications like CFA or CFP often preferred)
Financial Consultant.job_outlook: 15% growth from 2023 to 2033 (much faster than average)

Marketing Consultant.description: Help businesses develop and implement effective marketing strategies to reach their target audience. Analyze market trends, create marketing campaigns, and measure their effectiveness.
Marketing Consultant.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or related field (experience in marketing preferred)

Human Resources Consultant.description: Advise organizations on human resources practices, policies, and strategies. Help improve employee relations, recruitment processes, and overall HR management to enhance organizational performance.
Human Resources Consultant.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in human resources, business administration, or related field (certifications like SHRM-CP or PHR often preferred)

IT Consultant.description: Provide expertise in information technology to help businesses improve their IT systems, enhance cybersecurity, and implement new technologies. Analyze IT infrastructure and recommend solutions to optimize performance.
IT Consultant.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or related field (certifications like CISSP or CCNA often preferred)

Operations Consultant.description: Analyze and improve business operations to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and increase productivity. Work with organizations to streamline processes and implement best practices.
Operations Consultant.typical_education: Bachelor's degree in business administration, management, or related field (experience in operations preferred)
